label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION canJump(nums)
        ASSIGN 0 TO positionIndex
        ASSIGN 0 TO maximumReach

        WHILE positionIndex LESS THAN LENGTH(nums)
            IF NOT(positionIndex LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO maximumReach)
                OUTPUT false
                EXIT FUNCTION
            END IF

            ASSIGN (positionIndex PLUS nums[positionIndex]) TO candidateReach
            IF candidateReach GREATER THAN maximumReach
                ASSIGN candidateReach TO maximumReach
            END IF

            INCREMENT positionIndex BY 1
        END WHILE

        IF maximumReach GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO (LENGTH(nums) MINUS 1)
            OUTPUT true
            EXIT FUNCTION
        END IF

        OUTPUT false
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canJump(nums)  
        SET farthest TO zero  
        FOR i FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF nums MINUS one  
            IF i GREATER THAN farthest  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
            SET possible_reach TO i PLUS element at position i of nums  
            IF possible_reach GREATER THAN farthest  
                SET farthest TO possible_reach  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        IF farthest GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO the LENGTH OF nums MINUS one  
            RETURN true  
        ELSE  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        DECLARE result AS list OF integers  
        DECLARE temp AS list OF integers  
        DECLARE bitmask AS integer  
        DECLARE index AS integer  
        
        IF NOT (n NOT EQUALS 0) THEN  
            RETURN [0]  
        END IF  
        
        SET temp AS grayCode(n - 1)  
        SET bitmask AS 1 << (n - 1)  
        
        SET result AS temp  
        SET index TO LENGTH(temp) - 1  
        
        WHILE index GREATER OR EQUAL TO 0 DO  
            APPEND (temp[index] BITWISE_OR bitmask) TO result  
            DECREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION grayCode(n)  
        IF n EQUALS zero  
            RETURN a list containing zero  
        END IF  
        SET prev_gray TO the result of calling grayCode with the value of n MINUS one  
        SET mask TO one MULTIPLIED BY two RAISED TO the power of n MINUS one  
        SET current_gray TO concatenation of prev_gray WITH a list constructed by taking each number IN the reversed prev_gray AND applying bitwise OR with mask  
        RETURN current_gray  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minCut(s)  
        SET length_s AS the LENGTH OF s  
        
        IF NOT (length_s GREATER THAN one)  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET palindrome_flag TO a list of length_s elements each containing a list of length_s elements initialized to FALSE  
        
        SET idx TO zero  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN length_s  
            SET palindrome_flag[idx][idx] AS TRUE  
            INCREMENT idx BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET substr_len TO two  
        WHILE substr_len LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s  
            SET start_pos TO zero  
            WHILE start_pos LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO length_s MINUS substr_len  
                SET end_pos TO start_pos PLUS substr_len MINUS one  
                
                IF substr_len EQUALS two THEN  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                ELSE  
                    SET chars_match AS (s[start_pos] EQUALS s[end_pos])  
                    SET inner_palindrome AS palindrome_flag[start_pos PLUS one][end_pos MINUS one]  
                    SET palindrome_flag[start_pos][end_pos] AS (chars_match AND inner_palindrome)  
                END IF  
                
                INCREMENT start_pos BY one  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT substr_len BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET min_cut_counts TO a list of length_s elements initialized as zero  
        
        SET i TO zero  
        WHILE i LESS THAN length_s  
            IF palindrome_flag[zero][i] THEN  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS zero  
            ELSE  
                SET min_cut_counts[i] AS positive infinity  
                SET j TO one  
                WHILE j LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO i  
                    IF palindrome_flag[j][i] AND ((min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one) LESS THAN min_cut_counts[i]) THEN  
                        SET min_cut_counts[i] AS (min_cut_counts[j MINUS one] PLUS one)  
                    END IF  
                    INCREMENT j BY one  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT i BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN min_cut_counts[length_s MINUS one]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minCut(s)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO one  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        
        SET is_palindrome TO a two dimensional collection of size n by n filled with FALSE  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            SET element at position i at position i of is_palindrome TO TRUE  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR length FROM two TO n  
            FOR start FROM zero TO n MINUS length  
                SET end TO start PLUS length MINUS one  
                IF length EQUALS two  
                    SET element at position start at position end of is_palindrome TO the condition that element at position start of s EQUALS element at position end of s  
                ELSE  
                    SET element at position start at position end of is_palindrome TO the condition that element at position start of s EQUALS element at position end of s AND the element at position start PLUS one at position end MINUS one of is_palindrome  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        SET min_cuts TO a collection of size n filled with zero  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            IF element at position zero at position i of is_palindrome  
                SET element at position i of min_cuts TO zero  
            ELSE  
                SET element at position i of min_cuts TO positive infinity  
                FOR j FROM one TO i  
                    IF element at position j at position i of is_palindrome AND element at position j MINUS one of min_cuts PLUS one LESS THAN element at position i of min_cuts  
                        SET element at position i of min_cuts TO element at position j MINUS one of min_cuts PLUS one  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN element at position n MINUS one of min_cuts  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        DECLARE polarity AS string  
        IF (numerator < 0 AND denominator >= 0) OR (numerator >= 0 AND denominator < 0) THEN  
            polarity ← "-"  
        ELSE  
            polarity ← ""  
        ENDIF  
  
        numerator ← ABS(numerator)  
        denominator ← ABS(denominator)  
  
        DECLARE integralQuotient AS integer ← numerator DIV denominator  
        DECLARE modValue AS integer ← numerator MOD denominator  
        DECLARE integerString AS string ← TO_STRING(integralQuotient)  
  
        IF modValue = 0 THEN  
            RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString)  
        ENDIF  
  
        DECLARE remainderPositions AS MAP FROM integer TO integer ← EMPTY MAP  
        DECLARE digits AS LIST OF string ← EMPTY LIST  
  
        DECLARE currentRemainder AS integer ← modValue  
        WHILE currentRemainder ≠ 0 DO  
            IF remainderPositions CONTAINS currentRemainder THEN  
                DECLARE cycleStart AS integer ← remainderPositions[currentRemainder]  
                DECLARE prefix AS string ← ""  
                DECLARE suffix AS string ← ""  
                FOR idx FROM 0 TO cycleStart - 1 DO  
                    prefix ← CONCAT(prefix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                FOR idx FROM cycleStart TO LENGTH(digits) - 1 DO  
                    suffix ← CONCAT(suffix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", prefix, "(", suffix, ")")  
            ENDIF  
  
            remainderPositions[currentRemainder] ← LENGTH(digits)  
  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder * 10  
            DECLARE digitValue AS integer ← currentRemainder DIV denominator  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder MOD denominator  
            APPEND TO digits: TO_STRING(digitValue)  
        ENDWHILE  
  
        RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", JOIN(digits))  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        IF numerator LESS THAN zero AND denominator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero OR numerator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND denominator LESS THAN zero  
            SET sign TO the string indicating negative  
        ELSE  
            SET sign TO the empty string  
        END IF  
  
        SET numerator TO the absolute value of numerator  
        SET denominator TO the absolute value of denominator  
  
        SET quotient TO the integer division result of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET remainder TO the remainder of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET integer_part TO the string representation of quotient  
  
        IF remainder EQUALS zero  
            RETURN the concatenation of sign and integer_part  
        END IF  
  
        SET seen_remainders TO an empty mapping from remainder values to positions  
        SET fractional_part TO an empty list  
  
        WHILE remainder NOT EQUALS zero  
            IF remainder EXISTS AS a key in seen_remainders  
                SET start TO the value associated with remainder in seen_remainders  
                SET non_repeating TO the concatenation of elements from position zero UP TO position start EXCLUDING start in fractional_part  
                SET repeating TO the concatenation of elements FROM position start TO the end of fractional_part  
                RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, non_repeating, the opening parenthesis string, repeating, and the closing parenthesis string  
            END IF  
  
            ASSIGN to seen_remainders at key remainder the current length of fractional_part  
  
            SET remainder TO remainder MULTIPLIED BY ten  
            SET quotient TO the integer division result of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            SET remainder TO the remainder of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            APPEND the string representation of quotient TO fractional_part  
        END WHILE  
  
        RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, and the concatenation of all elements in fractional_part  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maxProduct(words)
        DECLARE char_sets AS empty list
        DECLARE idx1 AS 0
        WHILE idx1 < LENGTH(words)
            DECLARE temp_set AS empty set
            DECLARE pos AS 0
            WHILE pos < LENGTH(words[idx1])
                SET temp_set TO temp_set UNION { words[idx1][pos] }
                SET pos TO pos + 1
            END WHILE
            APPEND temp_set TO char_sets
            SET idx1 TO idx1 + 1
        END WHILE

        SET highest_product TO 0

        DECLARE first_pointer AS 0
        WHILE first_pointer < LENGTH(words) - 1
            DECLARE second_pointer AS first_pointer + 1
            WHILE second_pointer < LENGTH(words)
                DECLARE intersection_check AS char_sets[first_pointer] INTERSECT char_sets[second_pointer]
                IF LENGTH(intersection_check) = 0 THEN
                    DECLARE candidate_product AS (LENGTH(words[first_pointer]) * LENGTH(words[second_pointer]))
                    IF candidate_product > highest_product THEN
                        SET highest_product TO candidate_product
                    END IF
                END IF
                SET second_pointer TO second_pointer + 1
            END WHILE
            SET first_pointer TO first_pointer + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN highest_product
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maxProduct(words)  
        SET word_sets TO empty list  
        FOR each word IN words  
            APPEND the set of characters of word TO word_sets  
        END FOR  
        
        SET max_product TO zero  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF words MINUS one  
            FOR j FROM i PLUS one TO the LENGTH OF words MINUS one  
                IF the intersection of element at position i of word_sets AND element at position j of word_sets EQUALS empty set  
                    SET product TO the LENGTH OF element at position i of words MULTIPLIED BY the LENGTH OF element at position j of words  
                    IF product GREATER THAN max_product  
                        SET max_product TO product  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN max_product  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION bulbSwitch(n)  
        DECLARE result AS INTEGER  
        SET result TO 0  
        WHILE (result + 1) * (result + 1) <= n DO  
            INCREMENT result BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION bulbSwitch(n)  
        RETURN the integer part of the square root of n  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countNumbersWithUniqueDigits(n)  
        SWITCH n  
            CASE 0:  
                RETURN 1  
            CASE 1:  
                RETURN 10  
        END SWITCH  
  
        SET total_sum AS 10  
        SET digits_left AS 9  
        SET product AS 9  
        SET index AS 2  
        WHILE index <= n DO  
            SET product AS product * digits_left  
            SET total_sum AS total_sum + product  
            SET digits_left AS digits_left - 1  
            SET index AS index + 1  
        END WHILE  
  
        RETURN total_sum  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countNumbersWithUniqueDigits(n)  
        IF n EQUALS zero THEN  
            RETURN one  
        END IF  
        IF n EQUALS one THEN  
            RETURN ten  
        END IF  
        SET count TO ten  
        SET available_digits TO nine  
        SET choices TO nine  
        FOR i FROM two TO n INCLUSIVE  
            SET choices TO choices MULTIPLIED BY available_digits  
            SET count TO count PLUS choices  
            SET available_digits TO available_digits MINUS one  
        END FOR  
        RETURN count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION originalDigits(s)  
        SET freqMap AS map of character counts in s  
        SET digitCounts AS list WITH TEN elements INITIATED TO 0  
        
        SET digitCounts[0] AS freqMap['z']  
        SET digitCounts[2] AS freqMap['w']  
        SET digitCounts[4] AS freqMap['u']  
        SET digitCounts[6] AS freqMap['x']  
        SET digitCounts[8] AS freqMap['g']  
        
        SET digitCounts[3] AS freqMap['h'] - digitCounts[8]  
        SET digitCounts[5] AS freqMap['f'] - digitCounts[4]  
        SET digitCounts[7] AS freqMap['s'] - digitCounts[6]  
        
        SET tempI AS freqMap['i']  
        SET digitCounts[9] AS tempI - digitCounts[5] - digitCounts[6] - digitCounts[8]  
        
        SET tempO AS freqMap['o']  
        SET digitCounts[1] AS tempO - digitCounts[0] - digitCounts[2] - digitCounts[4]  
        
        SET collectionOfChars AS empty list  
        
        SET numberIdx AS 0  
        WHILE numberIdx LESS THAN 10  
            SET countRepeat AS digitCounts[numberIdx]  
            WHILE countRepeat GREATER THAN 0  
                APPEND STRING(numberIdx) TO collectionOfChars  
                ASSIGN countRepeat ← countRepeat - 1  
            END WHILE  
            ASSIGN numberIdx ← numberIdx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET outputString AS CONCATENATE elements of collectionOfChars SEQUENTIALLY  
        RETURN outputString  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION originalDigits(s)  
        SET count TO the collection of character frequencies in s  
        SET digits TO a list of ten zeros representing counts for zero to nine  
        SET element at position zero of digits TO the number of occurrences of character corresponding to letter z in count  
        SET element at position two of digits TO the number of occurrences of character corresponding to letter w in count  
        SET element at position four of digits TO the number of occurrences of character corresponding to letter u in count  
        SET element at position six of digits TO the number of occurrences of character corresponding to letter x in count  
        SET element at position eight of digits TO the number of occurrences of character corresponding to letter g in count  
        SET element at position three of digits TO the number of occurrences of character corresponding to letter h in count MINUS element at position eight of digits  
        SET element at position five of digits TO the number of occurrences of character corresponding to letter f in count MINUS element at position four of digits  
        SET element at position seven of digits TO the number of occurrences of character corresponding to letter s in count MINUS element at position six of digits  
        SET element at position nine of digits TO the number of occurrences of character corresponding to letter i in count MINUS element at position five of digits MINUS element at position six of digits MINUS element at position eight of digits  
        SET element at position one of digits TO the number of occurrences of character corresponding to letter o in count MINUS element at position zero of digits MINUS element at position two of digits MINUS element at position four of digits  
        SET result TO an empty list  
        FOR each index FROM zero TO nine  
            FOR each repetition FROM one TO element at position index of digits  
                APPEND string representation of index TO result  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        SET final_string TO the concatenation of all elements in result  
        RETURN final_string  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION frequencySort WITH PARAMETER s  
        DECLARE freqMap AS mapping from character to integer  
        FOR index FROM 0 TO LENGTH(s) - 1 DO  
            SET currentChar TO s[index]  
            IF freqMap DOES NOT CONTAIN currentChar THEN  
                SET freqMap[currentChar] AS 1  
            ELSE  
                SET freqMap[currentChar] TO freqMap[currentChar] + 1  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        DECLARE charList AS list of characters  
        SET charList TO KEYS OF freqMap  

        DECLARE descSortedChars AS list of characters  
        SET descSortedChars TO SORT charList BY (a, b) → (freqMap[b] - freqMap[a])  

        SET outputString TO EMPTY STRING  
        DECLARE iterator AS integer ← 0  
        WHILE iterator < LENGTH(descSortedChars) DO  
            DECLARE ch AS character ← descSortedChars[iterator]  
            DECLARE count AS integer ← freqMap[ch]  
            DECLARE tempString AS string ← EMPTY STRING  
            FOR repeatIndex FROM 1 TO count DO  
                SET tempString ← tempString + ch  
            END FOR  
            SET outputString ← outputString + tempString  
            SET iterator ← iterator + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN outputString  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION frequencySort WITH PARAMETER s  
        SET frequency TO the character frequency mapping of s  
        SET sorted_characters TO the list of characters in frequency arranged in descending order according to their frequency values  
        SET result TO an empty string  
        FOR each character IN sorted_characters  
            APPEND the character repeated the number of times equal to the frequency of the character TO result  
        END FOR  
        RETURN result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findContestMatch(n)  
        DECLARE bracketStrings AS empty list  
        DECLARE count AS 1  
        WHILE count LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n  
            INSERT TO bracketStrings THE STRING OF count  
            INCREMENT count BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        WHILE n NOT EQUAL TO 1  
            DECLARE index AS 0  
            DECLARE limit AS n DIV 2  
            WHILE index LESS THAN limit  
                DECLARE leftSide AS bracketStrings AT index  
                DECLARE rightSide AS bracketStrings AT (n - 1 - index)  
                ASSIGN bracketStrings AT index TO "(" + leftSide + "," + rightSide + ")"  
                INCREMENT index BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET n AS n DIV 2  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN bracketStrings AT 0  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findContestMatch(n)  
        SET teams TO an empty list  
        FOR number FROM one TO n  
            APPEND the string representation of number TO teams  
        END FOR  
        WHILE n GREATER THAN one  
            FOR i FROM zero TO n DIVIDED BY two MINUS one  
                SET teams at position i TO the concatenation of an open parenthesis concatenated with the element at position i of teams concatenated with a comma concatenated with the element at position n MINUS one MINUS i of teams concatenated with a close parenthesis  
            END FOR  
            SET n TO n DIVIDED BY two  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN the element at position zero of teams  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canTransform(start parameter, end parameter)  
        INITIALIZE filteredStart AS empty list  
        INITIALIZE posCounter TO 0  
        WHILE posCounter < LENGTH(start parameter) DO  
            ASSIGN currentChar TO start parameter[posCounter]  
            IF NOT (currentChar = 'X') THEN  
                SET filteredStart TO filteredStart CONCATENATED WITH [(currentChar, posCounter)]  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT posCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        INITIALIZE filteredEnd AS empty list  
        ASSIGN idxCursor TO 0  
        WHILE idxCursor < LENGTH(end parameter) DO  
            ASSIGN ch TO end parameter[idxCursor]  
            IF ch <> 'X' THEN  
                SET filteredEnd TO filteredEnd + [(ch, idxCursor)]  
            END IF  
            ASSIGN idxCursor TO idxCursor + 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF LENGTH(filteredStart) != LENGTH(filteredEnd) THEN  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  

        INITIALIZE pairIndex TO 0  
        WHILE pairIndex < LENGTH(filteredStart) DO  
            ASSIGN firstTuple TO filteredStart[pairIndex]  
            ASSIGN secondTuple TO filteredEnd[pairIndex]  

            ASSIGN charA TO firstTuple[0]  
            ASSIGN posA TO firstTuple[1]  
            ASSIGN charB TO secondTuple[0]  
            ASSIGN posB TO secondTuple[1]  

            IF NOT (charA = charB) THEN  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  

            IF charA = 'L' THEN  
                IF posA < posB THEN  
                    RETURN false  
                END IF  
            ELSE IF charA = 'R' THEN  
                IF posA > posB THEN  
                    RETURN false  
                END IF  
            END IF  

            SET pairIndex TO pairIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN true  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canTransform(start parameter, end parameter)  
        SET start_filtered TO empty list  
        FOR index FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF start parameter MINUS one  
            SET character_at_index TO element at position index of start parameter  
            IF character_at_index NOT EQUALS the character X  
                APPEND tuple of character_at_index AND index TO start_filtered  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET end_filtered TO empty list  
        FOR index FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF end parameter MINUS one  
            SET character_at_index TO element at position index of end parameter  
            IF character_at_index NOT EQUALS the character X  
                APPEND tuple of character_at_index AND index TO end_filtered  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        IF the LENGTH OF start_filtered NOT EQUALS the LENGTH OF end_filtered  
            RETURN false  
        END IF  
        FOR each pair of tuples first_pair AND second_pair IN the PAIRWISE ITERATION OF start_filtered AND end_filtered  
            SET character_one TO the first element of first_pair  
            SET index_one TO the second element of first_pair  
            SET character_two TO the first element of second_pair  
            SET index_two TO the second element of second_pair  
            IF character_one NOT EQUALS character_two  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
            IF character_one EQUALS the character L AND index_one LESS THAN index_two  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
            IF character_one EQUALS the character R AND index_one GREATER THAN index_two  
                RETURN false  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN true  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION reachingPoints(sx sx PARAMETER sy sy PARAMETER tx tx PARAMETER ty ty) RETURNS boolean
        LOOP_WHILE (tx IS_NOT_LESS_THAN sx) AND (ty IS_NOT_LESS_THAN sy)
            IF (NOT (tx IS_DIFFERS_FROM sx)) AND (NOT (ty IS_DIFFERS_FROM sy))
                RETURN True
            END IF

            IF tx IS_GREATER_THAN ty
                IF ty IS_GREATER_THAN sy
                    LET dividend = tx
                    LET divisor = ty
                    LET remainder = dividend MINUS (divisor TIMES FLOOR(dividend DIVIDED_BY divisor))
                    ASSIGN remainder INTO tx
                ELSE
                    LET numerator = tx MINUS sx
                    LET denominator = ty
                    LET modulusResult = numerator MINUS (denominator TIMES FLOOR(numerator DIVIDED_BY denominator))
                    IF NOT (modulusResult IS_NOT_EQUAL_ZERO)
                        RETURN True
                    ELSE
                        RETURN False
                    END IF
                END IF
            ELSE
                IF tx IS_GREATER_THAN sx
                    LET dividend = ty
                    LET divisor = tx
                    LET remainder = dividend MINUS (divisor TIMES FLOOR(dividend DIVIDED_BY divisor))
                    ASSIGN remainder INTO ty
                ELSE
                    LET numerator = ty MINUS sy
                    LET denominator = tx
                    LET modulusResult = numerator MINUS (denominator TIMES FLOOR(numerator DIVIDED_BY denominator))
                    IF NOT (modulusResult IS_NOT_EQUAL_ZERO)
                        RETURN True
                    ELSE
                        RETURN False
                    END IF
                END IF
            END IF
        END LOOP_WHILE
        RETURN False
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION reachingPoints(sx sx PARAMETER sy sy PARAMETER tx tx PARAMETER ty ty) RETURNS boolean  
        WHILE tx GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO sx AND ty GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO sy  
            IF tx EQUALS sx AND ty EQUALS sy  
                RETURN True  
            END IF  
            IF tx GREATER THAN ty  
                IF ty GREATER THAN sy  
                    SET tx TO the remainder of tx DIVIDED BY ty  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN the remainder of tx MINUS sx DIVIDED BY ty EQUALS zero  
                END IF  
            ELSE  
                IF tx GREATER THAN sx  
                    SET ty TO the remainder of ty DIVIDED BY tx  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN the remainder of ty MINUS sy DIVIDED BY tx EQUALS zero  
                END IF  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN False  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic
pseudocode:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isBipartite(graph)  
        ASSIGN size TO LENGTH(graph)  
        ASSIGN paint TO ARRAY OF size ELEMENTS FILLED WITH 0  
        
        FUNCTION dfs(vertex, shade)  
            paint[vertex] = shade  
            SET index TO 0  
            WHILE index < LENGTH(graph[vertex])  
                ASSIGN adj TO graph[vertex][index]  
                IF paint[adj] == shade THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                ELSE IF paint[adj] == 0 THEN  
                    IF dfs(adj, -shade) == False THEN  
                        RETURN False  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                index = index + 1  
            END WHILE  
            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        SET counter TO 0  
        WHILE counter < size  
            IF paint[counter] == 0 THEN  
                IF dfs(counter, 1) == False THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            counter = counter + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isBipartite(graph)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF graph  
        SET color TO a list of zeros with LENGTH n  
        
        FUNCTION dfs(node c)  
            SET the element at position node of color TO c  
            FOR each neighbor IN the element at position node of graph  
                IF the element at position neighbor of color EQUALS c  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
                IF the element at position neighbor of color EQUALS zero  
                    IF dfs(neighbor the NEGATION OF c) EQUALS False  
                        RETURN False  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            IF the element at position i of color EQUALS zero  
                IF dfs(i one) EQUALS False  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION flipgame(fronts, backs)  
        SET repeating TO empty set  
        DEFINE index AS 0  
        WHILE index LESS THAN the LENGTH OF fronts  
            SET front_val TO fronts[index]  
            SET back_val TO backs[index]  
            IF front_val EQUAL back_val THEN  
                ADD front_val TO repeating  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT index BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET combined_values TO empty set  
        FOR EACH val IN fronts DO  
            ADD val TO combined_values  
        END FOR  

        FOR EACH val IN backs DO  
            ADD val TO combined_values  
        END FOR  

        SET candidates TO empty set  
        FOR EACH val IN combined_values DO  
            IF NOT (val IN repeating) THEN  
                ADD val TO candidates  
            END IF  
        END FOR  

        IF LENGTH OF candidates IS NOT EQUAL TO 0 THEN  
            SET result TO NULL  
            SET iterator TO candidates.iterator()  
            SET result TO iterator.next()  
            WHILE iterator.hasNext() DO  
                SET current_val TO iterator.next()  
                IF current_val LESS THAN result THEN  
                    SET result TO current_val  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
            RETURN result  
        ELSE  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION flipgame(fronts, backs)  
        SET same TO empty set  
        FOR each pair of front_card AND back_card IN fronts AND backs simultaneously  
            IF front_card EQUALS back_card  
                ADD front_card TO same  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET all_numbers TO empty set  
        FOR each number IN fronts  
            ADD number TO all_numbers  
        END FOR  
        FOR each number IN backs  
            ADD number TO all_numbers  
        END FOR  
        SET good_numbers TO empty set  
        FOR each number IN all_numbers  
            IF number NOT IN same  
                ADD number TO good_numbers  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        IF the LENGTH OF good_numbers IS GREATER THAN zero  
            SET minimum_good_number TO the smallest element IN good_numbers  
            RETURN minimum_good_number  
        ELSE  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numFactoredBinaryTrees(arr)  
        ASSIGN MODULO_CONST ← (10 ^ 9) + 7  
        SORT arr BY ascending order  
        
        INITIALIZE factorsCount AS empty mapping  
        FOR each element IN arr DO  
            SET factorsCount[element] ← 1  
        END FOR  
        
        SET outerIdx ← 0  
        WHILE outerIdx < LENGTH(arr) DO  
            SET currentVal ← arr[outerIdx]  
            SET innerIdx ← 0  
            WHILE innerIdx < outerIdx DO  
                SET divisorCandidate ← arr[innerIdx]  
                IF (currentVal − (currentVal DIV divisorCandidate) * divisorCandidate) = 0 THEN  
                    SET pairedFactor ← currentVal DIV divisorCandidate  
                    IF pairedFactor IN factorsCount THEN  
                        SET product ← factorsCount[divisorCandidate] * factorsCount[pairedFactor]  
                        SET factorsCount[currentVal] ← (factorsCount[currentVal] + product) MODULO MODULO_CONST  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                INCREMENT innerIdx BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT outerIdx BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        ASSIGN accumulation ← 0  
        FOR each countValue IN factorsCount DO  
            SET accumulation ← accumulation + countValue  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN accumulation MODULO MODULO_CONST  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numFactoredBinaryTrees(arr)  
        SET MOD TO ten raised to the power of nine PLUS seven  
        SORT arr IN ascending order  
        SET dp TO an empty mapping FROM elements of arr TO the number one FOR each element in arr  
        FOR index i FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF arr MINUS one  
            SET num TO element at position i of arr  
            FOR index j FROM zero TO i MINUS one  
                SET potential_factor TO element at position j of arr  
                IF num MODULO potential_factor EQUALS zero THEN  
                    SET right_child TO num DIVIDED BY potential_factor  
                    IF right_child EXISTS AS a key IN dp THEN  
                        SET dp of num TO dp of num PLUS dp of potential_factor MULTIPLIED BY dp of right_child  
                        SET dp of num TO dp of num MODULO MOD  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        SET total TO zero  
        FOR each value IN dp values  
            INCREMENT total BY value  
        END FOR  
        RETURN total MODULO MOD  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION longestMountain(arr)
        SET length_arr AS LENGTH OF arr
        SET maximum_length TO 0
        SET index_counter TO 1
        LOOP
            IF NOT (index_counter < length_arr - 1) THEN
                BREAK
            END IF

            IF (arr[index_counter - 1] < arr[index_counter]) AND (arr[index_counter] > arr[index_counter + 1]) THEN
                SET left_marker AS index_counter - 1
                SET right_marker AS index_counter + 1

                WHILE (left_marker > 0) AND (arr[left_marker - 1] < arr[left_marker])
                    left_marker ← left_marker - 1
                END WHILE

                WHILE (right_marker < length_arr - 1) AND (arr[right_marker] > arr[right_marker + 1])
                    right_marker ← right_marker + 1
                END WHILE

                SET current_mountain_length AS right_marker - left_marker + 1
                IF maximum_length < current_mountain_length THEN
                    maximum_length ← current_mountain_length
                END IF

                index_counter ← right_marker
            ELSE
                index_counter ← index_counter + 1
            END IF
        END LOOP
        RETURN maximum_length
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION longestMountain(arr)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF arr  
        SET longest TO zero  
        SET i TO one  
        WHILE i LESS THAN n MINUS one  
            IF element at position i MINUS one of arr LESS THAN element at position i of arr AND element at position i of arr GREATER THAN element at position i PLUS one of arr  
                SET left TO i MINUS one  
                SET right TO i PLUS one  
                WHILE left GREATER THAN zero AND element at position left MINUS one of arr LESS THAN element at position left of arr  
                    DECREMENT left BY one  
                END WHILE  
                WHILE right LESS THAN n MINUS one AND element at position right of arr GREATER THAN element at position right PLUS one of arr  
                    INCREMENT right BY one  
                END WHILE  
                IF longest LESS THAN right MINUS left PLUS one  
                    SET longest TO right MINUS left PLUS one  
                END IF  
                SET i TO right  
            ELSE  
                INCREMENT i BY one  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN longest  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION lastSubstring(s)  
        LET lengthVar BE LENGTH OF s  
        LET highestChar BE MAXIMUM CHARACTER IN s  
        LET positions BE AN EMPTY LIST  
        LET index COUNTER TO 0  
        WHILE index < lengthVar DO  
            IF s[index] = highestChar THEN  
                APPEND index TO positions  
            END IF  
            SET index TO index + 1  
        END WHILE  

        LET candidateSubstring BE ""  
        LET posIndex POINTER TO 0  
        WHILE posIndex < LENGTH OF positions DO  
            LET substringStart BE positions[posIndex]  
            LET tempSubstring BE SLICE OF s FROM substringStart TO (LENGTH OF s)  
            IF NOT (candidateSubstring >= tempSubstring) THEN  
                SET candidateSubstring TO tempSubstring  
            END IF  
            SET posIndex TO posIndex + 1  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN candidateSubstring  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION lastSubstring(s)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        SET max_char TO the MAXIMUM CHARACTER IN s  
        SET max_indices TO an empty list  
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            IF the element at position i of s EQUALS max_char  
                APPEND i TO max_indices  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET max_substring TO the empty string  
        FOR each start IN max_indices  
            SET current_substring TO the substring of s from position start TO the END  
            IF current_substring GREATER THAN max_substring  
                SET max_substring TO current_substring  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN max_substring  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

pseudocode:
```
CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION connectTwoGroups(cost)
        SET lengthA AS LENGTH OF cost
        SET lengthB AS LENGTH OF cost[0]

        SET dp AS LIST OF LISTS WITH (lengthA + 1) ROWS AND (2 ^ lengthB) COLUMNS FILLED WITH INFINITY
        dp[0][0] ← 0

        SET outerIndex TO 0
        WHILE outerIndex < lengthA
            SET maskIndex TO 0
            WHILE maskIndex < (2 ^ lengthB)
                SET innerIndex TO 0
                WHILE innerIndex < lengthB
                    dp[outerIndex + 1][maskIndex BITWISE_OR (1 << innerIndex)] ←
                        MINIMUM(
                            dp[outerIndex + 1][maskIndex BITWISE_OR (1 << innerIndex)],
                            dp[outerIndex][maskIndex] + cost[outerIndex][innerIndex]
                        )
                    innerIndex ← innerIndex + 1
                END WHILE

                SET checkIndex TO 0
                WHILE checkIndex < lengthB
                    IF (maskIndex BITWISE_AND (1 << checkIndex)) ≠ 0 THEN
                        dp[outerIndex + 1][maskIndex] ←
                            MINIMUM(
                                dp[outerIndex + 1][maskIndex],
                                dp[outerIndex + 1][maskIndex BITWISE_XOR (1 << checkIndex)] + cost[outerIndex][checkIndex]
                            )
                    ENDIF
                    checkIndex ← checkIndex + 1
                END WHILE

                maskIndex ← maskIndex + 1
            END WHILE
            outerIndex ← outerIndex + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN dp[lengthA][(2 ^ lengthB) - 1]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
```

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION connectTwoGroups(cost)  
        SET size1 TO the LENGTH OF cost  
        SET size2 TO the LENGTH OF element at position zero of cost  
        SET dp TO a two dimensional list with size1 PLUS one rows and two TO THE power OF size2 columns FILLED WITH infinity VALUE  
        SET element at position zero at position zero of dp TO zero  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO size1 MINUS one  
            FOR mask FROM zero TO two TO THE power OF size2 MINUS one  
                FOR j FROM zero TO size2 MINUS one  
                    SET element at position i PLUS one at position mask ORED WITH two TO THE power OF j of dp TO the MINIMUM VALUE BETWEEN element at position i PLUS one at position mask ORED WITH two TO THE power OF j of dp AND the SUM OF element at position i at position mask of dp PLUS element at position i at position j of cost  
                END FOR  
                FOR j FROM zero TO size2 MINUS one  
                    IF the BITWISE AND OF mask AND two TO THE power OF j IS NOT EQUAL TO zero  
                        SET element at position i PLUS one at position mask of dp TO the MINIMUM VALUE BETWEEN element at position i PLUS one at position mask of dp AND the SUM OF element at position i PLUS one at position mask XORED WITH two TO THE power OF j of dp PLUS element at position i at position j of cost  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN element at position size1 at position two TO THE power OF size2 MINUS one of dp  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maxTotalFruits(fruits AS list of list of integers, startPos AS integer, k AS integer) RETURNS integer  
        SET resultMax TO 0  
        SET currSum TO 0  
        SET windowStart TO 0  
        
        SET rightPtr TO 0  
        WHILE rightPtr < LENGTH(fruits)  
            SET currPos TO fruits[rightPtr][0]  
            SET currCount TO fruits[rightPtr][1]  
            SET currSum TO currSum + currCount  
            
            WHILE windowStart <= rightPtr  
                SET leftPos TO fruits[windowStart][0]  
                SET rightPos TO fruits[rightPtr][0]  
                SET leftCondInclusive TO (startPos - k)  
                SET rightCondInclusive TO (startPos + k)  
                SET distLeft TO ABS(leftPos - startPos)  
                SET distRight TO ABS(rightPos - startPos)  
                SET minDist TO IF distLeft < distRight THEN distLeft ELSE distRight  
                SET rangeSpan TO rightPos - leftPos  
                SET condition1 TO (leftCondInclusive <= leftPos) AND (leftPos <= rightCondInclusive)  
                SET condition2 TO (leftCondInclusive <= rightPos) AND (rightPos <= rightCondInclusive)  
                SET condition3 TO ((minDist + rangeSpan) <= k)  
                IF NOT (condition1 AND condition2 AND condition3) THEN  
                    SET currSum TO currSum - fruits[windowStart][1]  
                    SET windowStart TO windowStart + 1  
                ELSE  
                    BREAK  
                END IF  
            END WHILE  
            
            IF resultMax < currSum  
                SET resultMax TO currSum  
            END IF  
            SET rightPtr TO rightPtr + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN resultMax  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maxTotalFruits(fruits AS list of list of integers, startPos AS integer, k AS integer) RETURNS integer  
        SET max_fruits TO zero  
        SET total_fruits TO zero  
        SET left TO zero  
        
        FOR right FROM zero TO the length of fruits MINUS one  
            SET position TO the element at position zero of the element at position right of fruits  
            SET amount TO the element at position one of the element at position right of fruits  
            INCREMENT total_fruits BY amount  
            
            WHILE left LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO right AND NOT  
                (startPos MINUS k LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO the element at position zero of the element at position left of fruits AND  
                the element at position zero of the element at position left of fruits LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO startPos PLUS k AND  
                startPos MINUS k LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO the element at position zero of the element at position right of fruits AND  
                the element at position zero of the element at position right of fruits LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO startPos PLUS k AND  
                the minimum value of the absolute value of the element at position zero of the element at position right of fruits MINUS startPos AND the absolute value of the element at position zero of the element at position left of fruits MINUS startPos PLUS the element at position zero of the element at position right of fruits MINUS the element at position zero of the element at position left of fruits) LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO k  
            DO  
                DECREMENT total_fruits BY the element at position one of the element at position left of fruits  
                INCREMENT left BY one  
            END WHILE  
            
            IF max_fruits LESS THAN total_fruits  
                SET max_fruits TO total_fruits  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN max_fruits  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

label: cosmetic

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION maximumGood(statements)
        ASSIGN n AS LENGTH(statements)
        LET maximumCount BE 0
        LET mask BE 0
        WHILE mask < (1 << n)
            DECLARE truthful AS ARRAY OF n ELEMENTS FILLED WITH FALSE
            DECLARE deceitful AS ARRAY OF n ELEMENTS FILLED WITH FALSE
            LET position BE 0
            REPEAT UNTIL position = n
                LET bitmask BE (1 << position)
                IF (mask & bitmask) = bitmask THEN
                    truthful[position] ← TRUE
                ELSE
                    deceitful[position] ← TRUE
                END IF
                position ← position + 1
            END REPEAT
            LET isConsistent BE TRUE
            LET idx BE 0
            WHILE idx < n AND isConsistent
                IF truthful[idx] = TRUE THEN
                    LET innerIdx BE 0
                    REPEAT UNTIL innerIdx = n OR NOT isConsistent
                        LET statementValue BE statements[idx][innerIdx]
                        IF (statementValue = 0 AND truthful[innerIdx] = TRUE) OR (statementValue = 1 AND deceitful[innerIdx] = TRUE) THEN
                            isConsistent ← FALSE
                        END IF
                        innerIdx ← innerIdx + 1
                    END REPEAT
                END IF
                idx ← idx + 1
            END WHILE
            IF isConsistent THEN
                LET countTruthful BE 0
                FOR countIdx FROM 0 TO n - 1
                    IF truthful[countIdx] = TRUE THEN
                        countTruthful ← countTruthful + 1
                    END IF
                END FOR
                IF countTruthful > maximumCount THEN
                    maximumCount ← countTruthful
                END IF
            END IF
            mask ← mask + 1
        END WHILE
        RETURN maximumCount
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION maximumGood(statements)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF statements  
        SET max_good TO zero  
        FOR i FROM zero TO the NUMBER ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY n MINUS one  
            SET good TO a LIST OF n ELEMENTS EACH SET TO FALSE  
            SET bad TO a LIST OF n ELEMENTS EACH SET TO FALSE  
            FOR j FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
                IF the BITWISE AND of i AND the NUMBER ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY j EQUALS the NUMBER ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY j  
                    SET the element at position j of good TO TRUE  
                ELSE  
                    SET the element at position j of bad TO TRUE  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            SET valid TO TRUE  
            FOR j FROM zero TO n MINUS one WHILE valid HOLDS  
                IF the element at position j of good EQUALS TRUE  
                    FOR k FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
                        IF the element at position j of statements AT position k EQUALS zero AND the element at position k of good EQUALS TRUE OR the element at position j of statements AT position k EQUALS one AND the element at position k of bad EQUALS TRUE  
                            SET valid TO FALSE  
                            BREAK the inner FOR loop  
                        END IF  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            IF valid EQUALS TRUE  
                SET max_good TO the GREATER OF max_good AND the SUM OF elements in good WHERE each TRUE IS COUNTED AS one AND each FALSE AS zero  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN max_good  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION appealSum(s)
        DECLARE lastIndices AS list WITH size 26 INITIALIZED BY -1 REPEATEDLY
        DECLARE sumOfAppeals AS 0
        DECLARE currentValue AS 0
        DECLARE pos AS 0
        WHILE pos < LENGTH(s)
            DECLARE character AS s[pos]
            DECLARE letterIndex AS (ORD(character) - ORD('a'))
            DECLARE contribution AS (pos - lastIndices[letterIndex])
            currentValue ← currentValue + contribution
            sumOfAppeals ← sumOfAppeals + currentValue
            lastIndices[letterIndex] ← pos
            pos ← pos + 1
        END WHILE
        RETURN sumOfAppeals
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION appealSum(s)  
        SET last TO a list of length twenty six with each element set to minus one  
        SET total_appeal TO zero  
        SET current_appeal TO zero  
        FOR each position i AND character char IN the enumeration of s  
            SET index TO the numeric code of character char MINUS the numeric code of character a  
            INCREMENT current_appeal BY position i MINUS element at position index of last  
            INCREMENT total_appeal BY current_appeal  
            SET element at position index of last TO position i  
        END FOR  
        RETURN total_appeal  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION numFriendRequests(ages)
        FUNCTION request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)
            IF age_y <= (age_x / 2 + 7) THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE IF age_y > age_x THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE IF (age_y > 100) AND (age_x < 100) THEN
                RETURN false
            ELSE
                RETURN true
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        SET tally TO dictionary()
        SET idx TO 0
        WHILE idx < LENGTH(ages)
            IF ages[idx] IN tally THEN
                tally[ages[idx]] = tally[ages[idx]] + 1
            ELSE
                tally[ages[idx]] = 1
            END IF
            idx = idx + 1
        END WHILE

        SET accumulated TO 0
        SET p_age_x TO 1
        WHILE p_age_x <= 120
            SET p_age_y TO 1
            WHILE p_age_y <= 120
                IF request_will_be_sent(p_age_x, p_age_y) THEN
                    IF p_age_x = p_age_y THEN
                        accumulated = accumulated + (tally.get(p_age_x, 0) * (tally.get(p_age_y, 0) - 1))
                    ELSE
                        accumulated = accumulated + (tally.get(p_age_x, 0) * tally.get(p_age_y, 0))
                    END IF
                END IF
                p_age_y = p_age_y + 1
            END WHILE
            p_age_x = p_age_x + 1
        END WHILE

        RETURN accumulated
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS
true_positive:
CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numFriendRequests(ages)  
        FUNCTION request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)  
            RETURN NOT (age_y IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO age_x MULTIPLIED BY one half PLUS seven OR age_y IS GREATER THAN age_x OR age_y IS GREATER THAN one hundred AND age_x IS LESS THAN one hundred)  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET count TO list of zero repeated one hundred and twenty one times  
        FOR each age IN ages  
            INCREMENT element at position age of count BY one  
        END FOR  

        SET total_requests TO zero  
        FOR age_x FROM one TO one hundred and twenty  
            FOR age_y FROM one TO one hundred and twenty  
                IF request_will_be_sent(age_x age_y)  
                    INCREMENT total_requests BY element at position age_x of count MULTIPLIED BY element at position age_y of count MINUS one IF age_x EQUALS age_y ELSE element at position age_y of count  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  

        RETURN total_requests  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS
